question.Title: decoding base64 encoded zip file to get the original zip file
question.Body:
I am uploading a .zip file in the front end and converting it to a base64 URL using the readAsDataURL() method. I am sending the URL string to my backend. I am not able to decode the string to get the original contents of the uploaded .zip file

import base64from io import BytesIOimage_64_encode = "data:application/zip;base64,"starter = image_64_encode.find(',')zip_data = image_64_encode[starter+1:]file_data = bytes(zip_data, encoding="ascii")d=base64.b64decode(file_data)with open("zip_decode.zip", 'wb') as f:      f.write(d)

Please suggest me a way to extract the original contents of the zip file from this URL

this is the function i am using to encode the zip file

andleFileUpload(e){    let files = e.target.files;    console.log("files are", files);    let reader = new FileReader();    reader.readAsDataURL(files[0]);    reader.onload=(e)=>{        console.log("inside reader", e.target.result);    const url="http://ec2-3-85-140-138.compute-1.amazonaws.com:5000/api/upload";    const formData = {file: e.target.result}    return post(url, formData)    .then(response => console.log("result", response))    }}

answer.Body:
To write original contents of the uploaded .zip file into zip_decode.zip:

with open("zip_decode.zip", 'wb') as f:      f.write(base64.b64decode(image_64_encode.split(',', 1)[1]))
